pages.text: Herbalists typically do not recommend using herbs in their raw form in recipes. Most often, they need to be dried or ground. For the latter, a mortar and pestle serves as a simple yet crucial tool for any herbalist. With it, herbs can be ground, allowing them to more willingly impart their magical properties to the recipe.

pages.title: Crafting
pages.text: The wooden mortar and pestle - a reliable and essential tool on the workbench of any herbalist. $(br2)Of course, there exists a more durable version made of stone. More on that on next pages.

pages.title: Crafting
pages.text: The stone mortar and pestle - a sturdier counterpart to the wooden version, ensuring longevity and thus strongly recommended for use.
